title: Why can't riot detect when people change Flash keys?
body:
And just manually audit those accounts?

Seriously, so many accounts i have come across recently, and a lot of them just have random changes in flash key's, and it's really such a blatant showing that someone that shouldn't be is on that account.

Be such an easy way to get rid of a lot of the boosting that is still rampant in the game.

replies.body:
oh look, so and so has played 400 games top with a low w/r, yet the last 30 games they have a 95% w/r mid with different summoner key bindings and champions they've never played before.

hmmm nothing suss
And just so we are clear, the people that would be against this ARE the boosted players, if you weren't getting boosted, there wouldn't be any threat to your account through this.

Or you know they see it as a giant net that would create a shit ton more work for riot employees, catching potentially innocent players and have no garuntee it’s actually gonna get any result.

You’ve got three people in this thread alone who change there keys.

>catching potentially innocent players

Oh so you think it's normal to both change your flash key, and change your IP address, and then magically get better at the game.

Good to see logical thinking prevails.

Like oh no, riot might have to do some work to enforce their rules.... woe is them.

And it's not like it'd be hard to do either, especially since again, it's unusual for someone to have all 3 characteristics of changing IP address, changing flash keys AND magically getting tons better at the game. (which i will add, only one person in this topic said it was a changed IP address, and that one wouldn't be flagged if he is telling the truth, because his ability to play the game wouldn't change massively.)

EDIT: And not only that, who is meant to actually do the job then? the players shouldn't have to be going around finding boosted accounts.

1. I, as I have said before, change flash frequently.
2. My IP, much like most people, is dynamic. I have probably played LoL all over Australia.
3. I'm not poor and have more than one PC.
4. Sometimes I can go on a 15 game winning streak and other times, a 15 game losing streak.

It's awful seeing highschool children trying to understand detection because it's complicated. Boosted accounts could also be flagged and taken out in waves, which is more likely. Stop trying to makes sense of things you don't understand.

Except that's not what you suggested. You just suggested 
"Why can't riot detect when people change Flash keys? And just manually audit those accounts?"

Now your suddenly using a different definition, that's called moving the goal posts and its bullshit. 

Not to mention I'm sure Riot will have something in place to keep an eye on those accounts that share those characteristics. But I'm betting they need a bit more evidence to prove boosting than you do. But we'll never know for sure because Riot rightly refuses to release the characteristics they look for in boosters and scripters. 

They do the job, but be realistic the player base for league is huge there never going to catch every single booster. But players reporting potential boosters would help. So maybe instead of constantly complaining submit a support ticket.

"they do the job"

No, they do not.

And part of the manual Audit would be checking for IP address changes, fact is that Flash key changes aren't the only showing of a boosted account, so you would check for all the rest, but the change in flash key should trigger it just like reporting someone would.

But hey why would i expect logic from blind rito ass kissing?

Fact i've ran into at least 3 accounts last night that show clear signs of all of what i have said (flash changing, massive changes in win rate) but it shouldn't be on the PLAYERS to do RIOT'S job for them (and believe it or not, it is).

I don't blindly kiss Riot's ass but with you around I always end you taking Riot's side because you treat them like a freaking Bond villain. There are plenty of things they could improve on, even they agree with that. But you oversimplify every single problem they face. If these things were easy to deal with all game companies would have eliminated these behaviors years ago.

because some people aren't 100% consistent on their key bindings. Back in season 6, I'd regularly swap key bindings for champions with dashes on e, just so it was easier for me to flash-dash or dash-flash, or when I played jungle shaco, i'd run ignite on f, and smite on d, instead of normally having smite on f, because it reminded me to keep up earlygame map pressure.

1) it's specifically flash
2) a manual Audit DOESN'T mean an instant ban, it means riot will check for IP address changes, and changes in ranked behaviour when this occurs.

That's where the manual audit comes in, and it's a matter of a booster is likely to have the 3 main factors (flash key changes, IP changes, Massive win rate increases) and if it's a normal thing that you do, it can also likely be noted on Rito's side anyway.

I change my Flash key when I play at a friend's house, usually because I don't have my RAZER NAGA, so I shove everything on mostly default settings.

There's also moments when on certain champs I'll change my Flash around because of another summoner I pick up instead of Smite or Ignite/Heal.
Check my other comment to Nightjar.
Yeah I think cheesyleeks summed it up pretty nicely.
I change mine depending on the champ.
